description.narrative:
A Master student from Utrecht University of the department Science and Innovation Management completed a practical period in summer 2012 with Agriterra. The objectives of the study he conducted were : - to link innovation theories with the practise of a farmers organisation - To better understand how innovation policies can be applied in practise - Support the National Farmers Federation of Moldova (NFFM) in defining criteria for an innovation fund.
The results of the case study were shared with NFFM, and NFFM has started operating the innovation fund since December 2012. Agriterra is inspired by the findings of this short reserach and offered assistance to the student to deepen the research on innovation in the agricultural sector in developing countries.
The university of Utrecht is providing the academic and theorithical coaching to the student to complete his master thesis, whereas Agriterra offered to make its network of farmers organisations in the Netherlands and developoing countries as well as resource persosn available for conducting the practical reserach work. Agriterra will support the student to conduct field work in two developing countries (Moldova and most likely Peru) . Agriterra will provide backstopping to the student on the more practical part of the research; identify suitable farmers organisation to conduct the field work and liaise with them; financially support the realistion of the field work; avail working space to the student at the office and support in the preparation and implementation of the field work.
The main topic of the research is: what structural elements and mechanism can strengthen agricultural innovation in developing countries?
See research proposal: innovating in developing countries; the elements and mechanism that matter
